original:
The concept of cyberdeutocracy emerges from the work of political theorist Karl Deutsch, who hypothesized the existence of "information elites" that control mass communication and, consequently, power institutions. These institutions operate based on the strategic use of information in their activities. Deutsch introduced the term "deutocracy," a blend of his name and "autocracy," to describe this phenomenon.

Cyberdeutocracy expands up
